definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: A follower of the bandit landlord Ko Tseng-chiang, he kidnaped people for ransom, stole goods and plundered land.
sentences.chinese: 他绑架诈取赎金，偷东西，还强占别人土地。

sentences.english: Youhave murdered a innocent man and have taken his belongings too.
sentences.chinese: 你谋杀了一个无辜的人并强占了他的财产。

sentences.english: Hong Kong was British Colony occupied for opium wars, exploitations.
sentences.chinese: 香港被英国强占，发动多次鸦片战争，侵略中国。

sentences.english: Just married man still eager for action, or strong had strong to be another matter.
sentences.chinese: 只是已婚男子还蠢蠢欲动，或强占强霸就另当别论了。

sentences.english: The domestic and foreign each big bank also allin abundance usurps the credit card market.
sentences.chinese: 国内外的各大银行也都纷纷强占信用卡市场。

sentences.english: A hostile take-over of the troop by an outsider male means tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 若外来的公猴强占母猴群就会发生悲剧。

sentences.english: You can not extend sovereignty over the area that you forcibly occupy.
sentences.chinese: 任何国家都不可以对强占的地区申索主权。

sentences.english: Nozick says, if you think about it, taxation amounts to the taking of earnings.
sentences.chinese: 仔细想想，诺齐克说征税相当于强占收入。

definition: to press into service/to impress/to commandeer
to take for one's own/to expropriate
to appropriate to oneself (what rightfully belongs to others)
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
